com.tcss543.graphgenerationcode.mesh

Class MeshGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tcss543.graphgenerationcode.mesh.MeshGenerator

  • public class MeshGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class generates text files representing mesh graph flow networks. The mesh graphs have edges from s to each node in the first column, from each internal node to the node on its right, both ways between every internal node and the nodes above and below it, and from the last column nodes to the sink. The file format is the standard TCSS 343/543 format of 'first vertex' 'second vertex' 'capacity'. The program takes command line arguments. They are: [# of rows] [# of columns][capacity or maximum capacity][filename][-cc flag]. All arguments are optional. If you enter no arguments, you get a 3 x 4 mesh with capacity of 1 on all edges, printed to System.out. The arguments are: #rows/columns - self-explanatory...defaults to 3x4 if no arguments are given capacity - defaults to 1(fixed) if <3 arguments. Otherwise random on the range 1 to capacity, unless '-cc' set. filename - the name of file to write to. Defaults to System.out if <4 parameters (or if -cc is last parameter) -cc flag...With at least the first three parameters specified, ending the line with '-cc' will cause edge capacities to have a constant value of c.
    Version:
    November 21, 2008
    Author:
    TCSS 543 group 2: Apaporn Boonyaratta, Richard Hill, Quang Lu, & David Thaler

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public void generate()
        The run method.

      • line

        private void line(int i1,
                  int j1,
                  int i2,
                  int j2,
                  int cap)
        Utility method to generate one line of output at an interior node in the graph. The line reads 'first node' 'second node' capacity , where the nodes are represented as (row #, column #). This method should be called with the correct capacity for this node; it doesn't generate them.
        Parameters:
        i1 - - first node row #
        j1 - the j 1
        i2 - the i 2
        j2 - the j 2
        cap - - the capacity entry

      • capacity

        private int capacity()
        Utility method to generate edge capacities for mesh graph generator. These are constant with value c if the constCap flag is set, random on the range from 1 to c otherwise.
        Returns:
        either c or a random number from 1 to c

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments
